intro: Aeluropus littoralis subsp. pungens, commonly known as the coastal arrowgrass, is a halophytic plant adapted to saline and coastal environments. It typically grows in sandy or muddy soils along shorelines, estuaries, and salt marshes. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers. It is well-suited to withstand high salinity and periodic tidal flooding. Its ecological role includes stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
